KPK Panggil 2 Orang Saksi Tersangka RJ Lino, Dugaan Suap Pengadaan Quay Container Crane
04 Nov 2019, 11:26 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Panggil 2 Orang Saksi Tersangka RJ Lino, Dugaan Suap Pengadaan Quay Container Crane

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) hari ini dijadwalkan memanggil 2 orang saksi terkait kaus dugaan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) suap proyek pengadaan pengadaan Quay Container Crane (QCC) di PT Pelabuhan Indonesia (Pelindo) II.
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta menjelaskan bahwa 2 orang saksi tersebut dijadwalkan diperiksa untuk tersangka Richard Joss Lino atau RJ Lino, mantan Direktur Utama (Dirut) PT Pelindo II (Persero)
"Dijadwalkam pemeriksaan terhadap 2 orang saksi untuk tersangka RJL (Richard Joss Lino) dalam penyidikan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) pengadaan QCC di  PT. Pelindo II," kata Febri Diansyah  di Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).
Febri menjelaskan bahwa kedua saksi yang dipanggil masing-masing pegawai PT Pelindo II atau Deputi Manajer Operasi Terminal 3 PT Pelabuhan Tanjung Priok (perusahaan afiliasi PT Pelindo II) Wahyu Hardiyanto dan mantan Direktur Teknik dan Operasional PT Pelabuhan Indonesia (Pelindo) II Ferialdy Noerlan.
Badan Reserse Kariminal (Bareskrim) Mabes Polri  sebelumnya telah menetapkan Ferialdy sebagai tersangka dalam kasus ini. Ferialdy diduga terlibat sebagai dalam kasus dugaan suap proyek pengadaan QCC di PT. Pelindo II.
Penyidik KPK sebelulmya telah mendalami keterangan saksi atas nama Dian M. Noer. Yang bersangkuatan merupakan mantan Direktur Keuangan (Dirkeu) Pelindo 2009 hingga 2012 terkait prores pencairan dana untuk pengadaan QCC di Pelindo II.
Penyidik KPK telah menetapkam RJ Lino sebagai tersangka sejak 15 Desember 2015 karena yang bersangkutan diduga memerintahkan pengadaan tiga QCC dengan menunjuk langsung perusahaan HDHM (PT Wuxi Hua Dong Heavy Machinery. Co.Ltd.) dari China sebagai penyedia barang.
Penyidik KPK menduga bahwa pengadaan tiga unit QCC tersebut tidak disesuaikan dengan persiapan infrastruktur pendukung yang saat itu dinilai masih belum memadai
Menurut KPK pengadaan QCC itu diduga  sangat dipaksakan dan suatu bentuk penyalahgunaan wewenang dari RJ Lino yang saat itu masih menjabat sebagai Dirut PT Pelindo II demi menguntungkan dirinya, orang lain atau korporasi.

KPK Summons 2 Witnesses, RJ Lino, Allegedly Bribery Procurement of Quay Container Crane
04 Nov 2019, 11:26 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Summons 2 Witnesses, RJ Lino, Allegedly Bribery Procurement of Quay Container Crane

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) today are scheduled to summon 2 witnesses related to the alleged corruption Corruption (QT) bribery project for the procurement of a Quay Container Crane (QCC) procurement project at PT Pelabuhan Indonesia (Pelindo) II.
KPK Head of Public Relations, Febri Diansyah, told reporters in Jakarta that the two witnesses were scheduled to be questioned for the suspect Richard Joss Lino or RJ Lino, former President Director of PT Pelindo II (Persero)
"Scheduled an examination of 2 witnesses for the suspect RJL (Richard Joss Lino) in the investigation of the Corruption Criminal Act (Corruption) of QCC procurement at PT. Pelindo II," said Febri Diansyah in Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
Febri explained that the two witnesses summoned by each employee of PT Pelindo II or Deputy Manager of Terminal 3 Operations of PT Pelabuhan Tanjung Priok (an affiliated company of PT Pelindo II) Wahyu Hardiyanto and former Technical and Operational Director of PT Pelabuhan Indonesia (Pelindo) II Ferialdy Noerlan.
The Criminal Investigation Body (Bareskrim) of the National Police Headquarters has previously named Ferialdy as a suspect in this case. Ferialdy allegedly involved as in the case of alleged bribery of the QCC procurement project at PT. Pelindo II.
The KPK investigator had previously explored witness testimony on behalf of Dian M. Noer. The suspect is a former Pelindo Finance Director (Dirkeu) from 2009 to 2012 related to the disbursement of funds for the procurement of QCC in Pelindo II.
KPK investigators have named RJ Lino as a suspect since December 15, 2015 because the person allegedly ordered the procurement of three QCCs by directly appointing an HDHM company (PT Wuxi Hua Dong Heavy Machinery. Co.Ltd.) From China as a supplier of goods.
KPK investigators suspect that the procurement of the three QCC units was not adjusted to the preparation of supporting infrastructure which at that time was considered inadequate
According to the KPK, the procurement of QCC was allegedly forced and a form of abuse of authority from RJ Lino who was then still serving as Managing Director of PT Pelindo II to benefit himself, others or the corporation.
